description: Erection of single storey rear extension (6.00m in depth, maximum height of 3.27m and eaves height of 2.97m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition Condition 5 (Materials Samples) of planning application ref 23/00567/OUT allowed on Appeal APP/Z5630/W/23/3321649 states:'No development shall commence until details / samples of the materials  to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension  hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details / samples.'Officers note the submitted samples of brick and render, which are considered to be acceptable. Further details of mortar to be used are required as it would affect the overall finish. The applicant has failed to provide details for the proposed windows (manufacturer specifications, material), window sills,  entrance door, details of the balconies, and architectural details such as horizontal banding (manufacture details are required). Such details are crucial and would affect the overall quality and appearance of the building.

Please revise the householder validation check list with updated information. Please check the new local list in our website before filling the householder validation checklist.The new local list and validation checklists can be obtained via the council's website- https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications.
